Title: Feeding ecology of marine cormorants in southwestern North America
Region: From the Bering Sea to southern California, few south of central California
Observation: Pellets, chick regurgitations and stomach samples
Food: Nematodes, decapod "shrimp"
Comments: Feed on solitary prey that hides in rocky reef substrates

Author: Ainley, Anderson and Kelly
Title: Feeding ecology of marine cormorants in southwestern North America
Region: From the Gulf of California north through Oregon
Observation: Pellets, chick regurgitations, and stomach samples
Food: Nematodes, decapod "shrimp"
Comments: Majority of prey species occur on or just above the bottom over both rocky and flat substrates

Author: Ainley, Anderson, and Kelly
Title: Feeding ecology of marine cormorants in southwestern North America
Region: From the Alaskan Peninsula to central Mexico
Observation: Pellets, chick regurgitations, and stomach samples
Food: Nematodes, decapod "shrimp"
Comments: Eat schooling prey that occurs from the surface to near bottoms having no relief
